titleStmt.title: John J. Gatewood and G. M. Mulligan to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6806

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Scottville Aug 22d 1865
Gov T. E. Bramlett Esqr
Dear Sir

We enclose you this morning the Petition of Dr R. J. D. Robb asking you to remit a fine as a Judgment agst him for Fifty dollars we state to you that we know the facts or most of them connected with the case Dr Robb is a nice clever Gentleman and his statements are entitled to the fullest Credit, and in view of all the facts & circumstances we most cheerfully recommend his case to your favorable consideration

Yours &c truly
John J. Gatewood
G M Mulligan
If remitted enclose to me & I will forward fee of $2 to Sety of State
